New Records: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 122 off 61 balls, his first international century in nearly three years.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar took 5 wickets for 4 runs, one of the best spells in T20 cricket.
Key Match Events: Kohli hit a blistering 122, and Kumar's exceptional bowling led to Afghanistan's collapse.
India's 101-run victory was their second-largest T20I win.
Pre-Game Insights: Kohli noted his improved form after a break and focused on enjoying the game again.
Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi acknowledged the team's lack of mental preparation.
Post-Match Reflections: Nabi admitted to missed opportunities and the difficulty of facing Kohli and Rahul's strong start.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the Asia Cup, and Kohli dedicated his century to his wife and daughter.
